sp.speaker: ANGELICA
sp.l: There are moments that the words dont reach
There is suffering too terrible to name
You hold your child as tight as you can
And push away the unimaginable
The moments when youre in so deep
It feels easier to just swim down

sp.speaker: ANGELICA/ENSEMBLE
sp.l: The Hamiltons move uptown
And learn to live with the unimaginable

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: I spend hours in the garden
I walk alone to the store
And its quiet uptown
I never liked the quiet before
I take the children to church on Sunday
A sign of the cross at the door
And I pray
That never used to happen before

sp.speaker: ANGELICA AND WOMEN
sp.l: If you see him in the street, walking by
Himself, talking to himself, have pity

sp.speaker: HAMILTON

sp.speaker: ANGELICA AND WOMEN

sp.speaker: ALL MEN

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: You knock me out, I fall apart

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: Can you imagine?

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Look at where we are
Look at where we started
I know I dont deserve you, Eliza
But hear me out. That would be enough
If I could spare his life
If I could trade his life for mine
Hed be standing here right now
And you would smile, and that would be enough
I dont pretend to know
The challenges were facing
I know theres no replacing what weve lost
And you need time
But Im not afraid
I know who I married
Just let me stay here by your side
That would be enough
